result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald Allen Moton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: SAME CONDITIONS AS PROBATION IF REVOKED, Except No HOC Time, or Community Service

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay court costs and victim witness surcharges by 12-30-16; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment. DOC may collect from up to 25% of prison funds, if revoked.
- Restitution set at zero.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms/ also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
- No contact with Calvin O., Darrell W., Dominic W.

timeConds.notes: STRAIGHT TIME; STAYED for use by the Agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald Allen Moton

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Reginald Allen Moton in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 1 day.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court does not suspend the defendant's drivers license
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-30 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME, STAYED for use by the agent.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with Calvin O., Darrell W., Dominic W.
-50 hours of community service
-Court costs and victim witness surcharges are to be paid by 12/30/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. DOC may collect from up to 25% of prison funds if revoked.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 12/30/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. DOC may collect from up to 25% of prison funds if revoked.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (if revoked):
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with Calvin O., Darrell W., Dominic W.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Reginald Allen Moton in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #03CF222 that are attached to the complaint.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of case# "08CF5943" on page 8.  Sworn for the state:Vincent Lopez-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Reginald Allen Moton in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Defendant Reginald Allen Moton in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
